intro: Schraderia dracocephaloides, commonly known as dragonhead skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and showy two-lipped flowers that resemble those of the mint family. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and blooms in the summer months. Schraderia dracocephaloides is often found in shaded or partially shaded areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
